headline: Trump Eviscerates Biden For Being ‘Incompetent’ – Predicts ‘Red Wave’ Is Coming
author: RobManess.com
sentences:
Fauci’s the king,” Trump said as the crowd chanted, “Lock him up.”
Trump also went after the House select committee that is investigating the January 6 riot, calling them “the unselect committee of political hacks.” He proceeded to call out what he sees as the inhumane treatment of those who were arrested for their roles in the Capitol riot.

“This is the year we take back the House, this is the year we take back the Senate and this is the year we take back America.”
With this rally, Trump sent a brutal message to Biden, Democrats, and RINOs everywhere.

“Partisan Democrats have celebrated their indefinite detention without trial.”
Trump made it clear that given the many failures of the left, he believes it will be a good year for Republicans.

“He’s never going to get my endorsement.”
Trump warned that “weak Republicans” who do not acknowledge election fraud and issues at the border will not be able to win elections.
Trump did not say whether or not he plans to run for president in 2024, but he did make a point of saying that “we are going to take back the White House” that year.
Though Trump said he will be making an endorsement in this Senate primary “at the right time,” he made it clear that he will not be endorsing Arizona Gov.
During his first rally of 2022, Donald Trump eviscerated Joe Biden and his administration for what the former president describes as his many failures.
While Trump has endorsed Republican gubernatorial candidate Kari Lake in Arizona, he has yet to issue an endorsement in the state’s Senate primary.
“2022, despite so far being a total catastrophe for the country, is going to be a big one for the people of this state,” Trump said.
“They’re incompetent, actually,” Trump said of the Biden administration while speaking in Florence, Arizona, according to The Hill.

“What’s happening to those people in those jails — why aren’t they doing it to antifa and Black Lives Matter?” Trump said.
He also expressed confidence that Republicans will be victorious in the midterm elections come November.
During this same speech, Trump lashed out at Biden’s chief medical advisor, Dr. Anthony Fauci.
“Somebody said, ‘Oh, he wants to run for the Senate,’” Trump said of Ducey.

“A great red wave is going to begin right here in Arizona,” Trump said.
Doug Ducey, who is rumored to be thinking about a senatorial run.
The former president is not going away quietly.
